A place for both scarabs and adventurers to find reprieve from the oppressive heat of Aeternum's deserts.
This pyramid-like structure sports a chimney for warmth and if the cycle of death and rebirth is interrupted, it may just be your last night by the fire.
For the growth and maintenance of a blossoming botanist. Just add water!
Whether your specialty is palm-reading or tarot cards, customers will line up at this tent for your predictions.
Shelter from the cold and rough wilds of Aeternum under the phases of the ever-changing moon.
Sharing a tent in Aeternum is among one of the most intimate experiences adventurers can experience, and this one is conveniently large for whatever your idea of a romantic night in is.
Rest easy knowing the spikes outside will intimidate most enemies away on sight.
This hardcore hut can withstand even the mightiest bear attacks with its metal framing.
Complete with outstretched arms and a Corrupted skull, this tent offers reprieve from the horrors of Aeternum.
Wrap yourself in a comforting cocoon of spider silk this Nightveil Hallow.
The carved jack-o-lanterns remind the behemoth of the pumpkinites you've put down in the name of securing Aeternum.
Relax in repose with a tent that springs forth from the ashes of Aeternum.
Even the most avaricious creature could be comfortable inside this spacious tent.
Aeternum may deny eternal rest, but you can still sleep like the dead within this tent.
You have everything you need for summertide camping, be it fishing or feasting.
Protect yourself from the icy winters of Aeternum in a standing tent.
Enjoy the view in elegant style with this standing tent.

For catching the fruit of the sea.
The reflective scales shimmer brightly in the light.
Securely locked, the box pulses with strange energy.
A pirate flag taken from the ship Satisfaction on behalf of the Captain Grace O'Malley.
Specialized tools used by Inquisitor Lucia
Worn by the Anointed who supported the Inquisition.
The strange ritebook distributed by Sacrist Johannes
Candles used by followers of Inquisitor Matthias to mark those whose souls were deemed strong
The medallion worn by a notoriously sadistic Inquisitor.
A satchel of some earthy-smelling substance carried by the Dryad warriors.
A powerful catalyst for healing magics.
A secondary component that Eclipse Warriors used in forging Dryad armor
Bloody cloth with imprinted memories of past menders.
A mysterious flower known for its curative properties.
A pure white, powder salve formulated by soothsayers on Aeternum.
Another component that Dryad warriors used in the forging of armor
Old, rusty, bent nails from a coffin suggesting it was broken open after being buried underground
Partially decomposed bones coated in dry dirt
These human bones appear to have been broken and reformed many, many times.
Specific type of Starmetal, a Starmetal that seems to twinkle even in daylight
Blades once used by those not afraid of stabbing a friend in the back.
A plank some unlucky pirates were once forced to walk.
Bindings to cruelly restrain prisoners, used by a notorious hangman.
A mysterious liquid that instantly coagulates spilled blood.
Scraps of writing from a mad man
Assorted tools used by the Corrupted for gathering lumber and mining
Old twine and chain that appears to have been used to restrain one of the Lost
Military orders from Reida's Burrow targeting the Lumberyard to serve as a bulwark against the Lost
Makes armor last twice as long.
One use will last for years.
Worked and reworked for maximum strength.
Strong protection for lining a helm.
Reinforcing metal, made to withstand the worst.
Ore infused with the heat of battle.
For weatherproofing all types of surfaces.
Pieces of the original Battle's Embrace.
Their shine may have faded, but they won't fail in battle.
Nice and thick, protected against everyday wear.
A token that can only come from a grave in Brackwater
A token that can only come from a grave in Walsham
A token that can only come from Moira the Unburied
A token that can only come from a grave in Brightrest
A focusing orb made by the Ancient mages long ago.
A dispatch sent from Eastburn Outpost that never arrived in Brightwood.
A barbed catfish with particularly nice whiskers.
A hooked squid known for its potent ink.
Packets of Food Supplies for the Rustheart Miners in Brightwood
A crate of weapons recently forged by the Rustheart Blacksmiths
A detailed drawing of an extremely effective weapon for forging
A sheaf of leaves that can be brewed into a Tea the Angry Earth Dryads imbibe
A sugary substance harvested from Young Trees in Lush Hideway
A handful of stems collected from Bronzeroot Shamans in the Verdant Cavern
A handful of spores collected from the remains of Ceran
A fine golden ring, slightly tarnished from a long period in a bear's digestive tract
A keepsake from Megara's once-happy life which is almost certain to make her sad
The journal of Megara Pantasazi from the happiest times in her life
A letter from Megara's Lost Husband, saying he's giving up so he won't bring her down
A tattered and rumpled cloak, bearing the Soulwarden insignia.
A piece of polished jade. When viewed closely, you can faintly make out the name "Patricia".
A set of rusted keys to a chest in Slumbering Echoes.
A collection of the stones that Dryad Archers integrate into their bodies.
A sack of supplies, stolen by the Corrupted from the Soulwardens.
A vial containing a thick black fluid. Smells awful, and no one should taste it.
A chunk of high quality ore from the Defiler Excavation.
A splinter of Azoth, recovered from a broken Ancient statue
A blackened talisman of unknown origin, bearing a simple symbol.
A blackened talisman of unknown origin, bearing a simple symbol.
A lantern from the back of a grave digging Ghoul. Formerly burned with the light of azoth, but is now dark.
A Heartgem from a Corrupted Soulwarden, stolen by a Cultist to use in their rituals.
A container bearing shot and powder, hidden from the Corrupted at Breakaway Fort.
A container bearing shot and powder, hidden from the Corrupted at Acedia Bastion.
A piece of polished amber. It has been scuffed and scratched, and is now unreadable.
A bundle of materials collected to craft the Rampant Conviction.
A case holding Goldstein's weighted scales, which always tip in their favor.
A small leather pouch holding a silver token, naming the ship a pirate serves on.
A scrap of fleshy leather carved from the body of a Monstrous Corrupted.
Discarded, powdery bones of the once-dead.
A strong and twisted vine, formerly of a Dryad's body.
The moss-covered heart of the Dryad, Vinesnap.
The dried stalk of a Corruption Tendril.
A spall of charged Starmetal Ore, brimming with energy.
Ore from the pockets of the Ambusti miners, contaminated by the proximity to Corruption.
A horn carved from the body of a freshly arrived Corrupted.
A warm, pulsating chunk of amber, taken from the heart of Malevolence.
A piece of polished amethyst. Letters can be faintly made out, but nothing else
A piece of polished aquamarine. It has been scuffed and scratched, and is now unreadable.
A piece of polished citrine. Appears as though it was beaten against rocks.
A piece of polished lapis. Has been damaged beyond readability.
A piece of polished moonstone. When the light strikes it, you can easily read "Sauquillo" across the front.
The thick, curled base of what is to be a mighty staff.
A narrow stem on which components can be added.
A curved staffhead meant to channel fire.
A collection of blisteringly hot flammable powders.
The flint ingredients to start a flame.
A device that concentrates forth whatever it is attached to.
The component that controls the flamethrower ability.
A thin metal barrel forged with azoth to concentrate flames.
A talisman once held by Joan the Faithless. Though broken, the talisman still contains the essences of her prayers and will heal once more.
A runestone once held by S'ylanx. Once purified, this evil stone can be a powerful catalyst for life magic.
A talisman dropped by an unholy priest. giving them protection. With some manipulation, the protection can be extracted.
An elemental crystal infused with life magics by the shamans of Edengrove.
Fragments of wood taken from corrupted acolytes. Cursed, but sturdy enough to be used as staff.
High quality Wyrdwood Tears gathered by Dryad soldiers. Its energy is a catalyst for life magic.
Incense that Dryad Shamans burn to improve their focus. Do not ingest, consult a shaman if visions last for more than 6 hours.
Wine crafted by the Stone Skull pirates. Please ingest responsibly, consult a pirate if vision doubles for more than 6 hours.
A bundle of materials collected to craft the Azure Ravager.
The concentrated essence of death, mined from a Blightcrag deposit.
A simple sailor's coin, blessed before leaving their home port.
A twisting branch pulled from a Dryad after death, still sprouting fresh leaves.
Globs of concentrated Corruption, from those fresh from a portal.
A formerly pure Azoth crystal, now tainted by Corruption.
The heart of a Hellfire, burning long after having been removed.
Chunks of pure orichalcum, covered in Corruption slime.
A chipped and broken iron hammerhead, crafted from Corrupted iron.
A strip of glimmering heartwood, pulled from within a Wyrdwood tree.
An incredibly sticky, almost invisible substance left behind by apparitions.
A sliver of unstable azoth, burning with a bright blue flame.
A strange whetstone with notable starmetal streaks throughout.
A batch of everchilled fungi that never lose their cold, even after being picked.
Corruption-infused silks taken from the body of a Legatus General.
A thick, gooey substance that leaves the hands with frostbite if touched for too long.
A rimed vine that pulses with the energy of the Dryad it was once a part of.
Gauntlet grips cold-forged to perfection that are pointed at the tips for extra piercing.
Shimmering plating of the finest material quality, frigid to the touch.
A twisted, gnarled heart of ice that still beats out of the chest of its Corrupted master.
Bullets filled with a blast of cold that can be manipulated into gauntlet parts.
A flag torn from a forlorn wreck [Mission Item]
Raw flesh marinaded in the fetid bile of the Withered.
A viscous and putrid substance that slowly corrodes all it touches.
A leaking jar of gruel tainted with the fetid bile of the Withered.
Concoctions of a blue-tinged liquid in small bottles that appears to have been intended as an inoculation against Corruption.
A haunch of meat harvested from an elk with fat clinging to the sinews.
An old, worn locket that has been passed down through generations of the Lewis family for good luck.
A heavily-worn silver brooch adorned with semi-precious stones and the initials T.P. engraved on the back.
An ore sample so brilliant it almost emits a soft glow. Gem shards can be seen within.
A sphere crafted by the hands of the Ancients.
A collection of pulsing red seeds that have been tainted by Corruption.
Small river stones with superstitious etchings carved into them.
A fluffy foot of a rabbit who might not consider the encounter to be a lucky one.
A flat clay disk with a rendering of the night sky.
A flat clay disk with a rendering of the night sky.
A flat clay disk with a rendering of the night sky.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
An Ancient device used to make astronomical measurements.
A model of the heavenly bodies consisting of several concentric rings to represent orbital patterns.
A ledger containing maps and information about Amrine Excavation.
A sparkling crown with a Starstone in the center.
A heavy, fragrant mushroom used for a variety of delicious purposes
All that remains of Huntsman Lee's ill-fated porter.
Stalks of corn just on the far edge of ripe without farmers to take them to market.
Free of blemishes, stains, and tears, this length of fur is supple enough to adorn even the most expensive of garments.
A strange orb that occasionally glows with points of lights arranged across its surface like a constellation.
A strange orb that occasionally glows with points of lights arranged across its surface like a constellation.
Astonishingly brittle, given the strength of the Guardian it fell from. Flecks of blue and teal glitter throughout the material.
The back is smooth and flat. The center depicts a series of circles overlapping one another in a sphere.
Inert, heavy, and sturdy despite its complexity, six star-shaped impressions adorn its central ring.
A high-quality craft from a time long before yours on Aeternum.
A tattered but legible scroll full of runes and glyphs.
An idol of a long-lost civilization. There's no telling how many of these still exist.
A special earth salting poison developed by artificer Tekla Petrowski.
Carved into the metal are the initials 'AK+TP'.
Blue flowers that Audrey Kelleher used to love collecting.
Though the wood has lost some of its luster, it is a well maintained instrument.
It strings thrummed by many fingers, the belly of this instrument has stayed true to form over the centuries.
A well-cared for instrument that may be more for looks than music.
Dented, cracked glass, and immobile hands suggest this item was treated carelessly.
Right where Saira told you it would be. You probably shouldn't open this.
Back-breaking work resulted in clean linens and undergarments.
Saira's patron surely won't notice it was ever broken.
An obscenely intricate diagram of the inner workings of a pocket watch.
Sealed with wax and embossed with gold-leaf lettering on crisp, quality parchment.
A hand-addressed note from one priveleged individual to another.
A sweet honey brew made by the Everfall Barkeep.
A dark red wine made by the Everfall Barkeep.
A mysterious bottle of mysterious origins. Unassuming, but full of a delicious liquid.
A hearty sake made by the Everfall Barkeep.
What could Anwir want this for?
You're not sure what they're for, but they're heavy.
An unusually strong-scented specimen that only grows in this particular graveyard.
For all you know, every single vial is full of colored water.
A stone tablet covered with the strange symbols and markings of the Ancient language
A pouch filled with paper and a supply of charcoal, used for taking impressions
The charcoal rubbing of a large Ancient plaque, found in Sunken Aspect
A deft copy of a broken Ancient map, found at the top of Skyview Repose
A globe filled with energy, acquired from the Guardian known as The Surgeon
A bag of Ancient Guardian hearts, collected from a pile of Ancient rubble
An unlocked - and reclosed - Ancient Guardian heart
A selection of gently harvested flowers, doused with Azoth Water
The writing is illegible, but the images of the parts of a Dryad are clear enough
A small Ancient metal container holding a few drops of pure azoth
A small cask of gunpowder, primed and ready for ignition.
Vines, freshly pruned from a Dryad
A chunk of brilliant azoth crystal, prized from the stones of Virid Grotto
An ever-burning eye that stares deeply into your soul.
A darkened energy source, awaiting new azoth
A glowing energy source, humming with the power of azoth
Water containing the purest concentration of azoth
A thin metal band with blackened runes inscribed along the inside
A single heavy filament, pulled from the remnants of an Ancient Guardian's armor
A thick leather glove, reinforced with stitching from the Ancient Guardians
Fibers drawn from the thick seed pod of a Wyrdwood tree
A fragment of Void Crystal, now buzzing with dark energy
Drained chunks of Void Crystal, awaiting an infusion of dark energy
A finely crafted lens, perfectly clear, made from the highest quality crystal
Small shards of the purest crystal
Thick and gooey, this natural resin provides protection against the darker energies of the island
Hardened and reinforced with the powers of the Protective Resin, this leather will protect the user from dark energy
A powder keg set with a fuse, ready for detonation
A delicious mixture of blueberries, sugar, and lemon with a subtle hint of allspice.
A hallowed candle, like the ones they give out to kids for halloween
This parcel of food supplies has recently been used as a chew toy.
Formerly, a high-grade ore of some unknown type. Now, a twisted and corrupted mess.
A large reddish-orange crystal shard. Its use is unknown.
They look similar to lithomancy stones, but no one is certain of their real use.
A flag torn from a forlorn wreck [Mission Item]
The "lucky" pilot's wheel from the ship Satisfaction, reclaimed on behalf of Captain Grace O'Malley.
An elaborately embellished French Astrolabe once used by Samuel Champlain.
A candelabra from the court of the late King Henry the Great of France.
An immaculate silver chalice that's said to have been blessed by Bishop Richelieu of Lucon.
A twisted coil of flesh, pulsing with a dim light. Pulled from the chest of the Sentinel Taskmaster.
A small, ornate jewelry box. Inside the lid, an inscription reads: “For my dear son, Amir Fayed. Peace on your journey.”
Amazingly fine fabrics, soft and silky to the touch.
Incredibly high quality thread, spun onto a wooden bobbin.
An assortment of vegetables, showing the range of foods available in Windsward.
An aromatic jerked fish, great for travel rations.
The starchy seed head of a bulrush which, when dried, makes excellent tinder.
A sharp piece of flint sheared from a larger stone, used to start a fire.
A short strip of steel which sparks when struck.
A set of quality antlers, claimed from a downed Elk.
A leather-bound notebook, filled with pages of detailed drawings, intricate notes, and calculations.
A organized, yet random, assortment of leaves, twigs, and rocks.
Head Scout Maddix's final notes during the defense of Bullrush Wash
A bag full of soil collected from Cooper's Ranch.
A sack full of soil collected from Merrill's Place.
A heavy and sealed jar of Corrupted sludge, gathered in Harplass Homestead.
A highly volatile explosive, made using fulminate of azoth.
A common stone hiding a rough gemstone inside, waiting to be cut.
A small phial of quality perfume, imported from the Old World.
A container of blessed oil, used during religious ceremonies.
Barbed briar branches, dripping bitter sap from the cut ends.
A dead, featherless turkey, wrapped and tied to keep it from spoiling your pack.
A dead, skinned rabbit. Exactly like it sounds.
A container full of rare and exotic peppers from the Old World.
A container full of rare and exotic cardamom from the Old World.
A container full of rare and exotic saffron from the Old World.
A simple woven basket, packed full of fresh strawberries.
A simple crate, stuffed full of freshly harvested ears of corn.
A pouch packed full of gunpowder, wadding, and balls used to reload flintlock muskets.
A noisy pouch full of stolen Musket Parts and Ammunition.
A collection of springs, hammers, and pans necessary to construct or repair a flintlock musket.
A marble-sized orb pulled from a strange Ancient device.
A strange device used by the Ancients in construction.
An Ancient sphere, still pulsing with energy
A palm-sized hunk of stone, warm to the touch. Almost feels like it vibrates when holding it
An eyepiece of great magnitude that allows one to see small details.
A big, tasty bone meant for chewing.
A bone for chewing that leaves a tingling sensation in the mouth.
These brushes are top-of-the-line with the finest points for the most delicate of paintings.
Tough, with an almost bitter flavor. But still better than more stringy wolf meat.
Surprisingly soft and warm, given the rough lives of the lions.
Each page is densely packed with sketches and other details about all the towers in Windsward.
A Sword forged by the famed Iron Rose Company
Roya's application to join the Iron Rose Company
Grain freshly milled from the windmills at Golden Fields.
The last vegetables harvested from Golden Fields.
A symbol of camaraderie too important to be left behind.
This letter is from Medea to the Company of the Iron Rose and expresses her displeasure over not receiving any tribute.
This contract goes into detail of how the pirates will steal Medea's tribute and in return will be paid with the location of jewels provided by the Speaker of the Winds.
Looks like tribute wasn't the only thing these pirates were stealing! There's a little bit of everything in these crates.
This looks exactly like Marcel's Hat… not to mention it has 'Dupont' embroidered on the interior lining.
Pulsing with ancient power, this gemstone is brimming with vitality.
With bold colors and sharp designs, still strong after all these years.
For weaving complex patterns on ancient looms.
A small part of a Wrywood tree. Holding in your hand gives a calming sensation. Its stem sparkles in the light.
A collection of armor plates and scraps pulled from the remains of Rockruin Carvers.
Everburning embers that generate no heat or smoke
Still pulsing with energy, waiting to come back to life
Fibrous material, stronger than any crafted rope
A powerful explosive, charged with the power of azoth. Ignite, then stand back!
A small vial of fluid with flecks of bright orichalcum floating within.
A finely ground powder of starmetal shards, for some unknown purpose.
A shimmering headdress full of gems and unknown powers.
A heavy, musky spice blend popular with the former residents of Desolate Cliffs.
Said to make you as hearty as the gators it comes from.
A leather draught bottle, its content long turned to dust. Smells vaguely of vinegar.
A round baetylus stone with worn grooves, from the hands of an owner long perished.
A huge claw covered in deep and bright etchings. Holding it seems to attract Corruption.
A dark mask of some unknown material. Blood has caked the inside.
Briars broken from Fay, the Last Protector.
A sample of the blight found in Shattered Mountain.
A concentrated piece of Corrupted flesh. Handle with care.
A blight sample from the Pox Cyst.
A piece of hand-polished jasper. The word "Soulwarden" can barely be seen amidst a shattered core.
A piece of hand-polished carnelian. Chips have been taken from the stone, rendering it unreadable
A piece of hand-polished topaz. Deep gouges have been ground into the stone.
A block crucible, used for smithing weapons.
No matter the position, the attached spear feels utterly weightless in your hand.
Embracing the temerity of the Ancients is only possible with their spirit.
A fragment of a Skygem. It shines a magnificent sky blue, and is aptly named.
That it survived both the violence of your acquisition and its time in Periville speaks to its superior craftsmanship.
A tear of purified azoth. Applying this is a quick way to infuse some power into gear.
It is impossible to say just how old they are, and yet they show no signs of wear.
Tendrils of vine blessed into peculiar shapes by the Dryads of Malevolence.
Tendrils from the Corrupted monsters in the Mangled Heights. Though Corrupted, their sharpness is second-to-none. Perfect for a spearhead.
Suddenly the quality of the Myrkgard’s weapons and armor makes more sense.
Very effective in scouring away impurities. Try not to get any on your hands.
Durable, strong, and perfect for affixing a shield to one’s arm or hand.
The parts that survived are all the stronger for it.
Said to protect the wearer from certain death. Perhaps it will fare better in your hands.
Crafted to armor the Dryads of Malevolence, it is said to provide protection against Corruption.
Blessed by the priests of Periville before its fall, it is suggested that the material bears an innate resistance to Corruption.
Seething with the might of its Corrupted host. When like calls to like, nothing will prevent your blade from rending Corrupted foes in twain.
Once thrown into the forge, the heat will burn away the matter and leave only raw Corrupted power to imbue into the blade.
Once thrown into the forge, the heat will burn away the matter and leave only raw Corrupted power to imbue into the blade.
Only the finest metal will do for this blade.
Capable of honing any blade it touches to a preternaturally sharp edge.
Used to wrap the hilts of the weapons carried by the Eridanite Dryads.
The blade will know the taste of its enemies, and will grow ever hungrier for more.
Said to enhance the innate properties of whatever it is applied to.
The dulled section at the foot of the blade carved with images of spectres.
The wrong end of the sword to be sticking someone with, but ultimately still useful for knocking heads.
Frozen crossguards that balance the blade and radiate cold.
Decorative and functional additions to any rapier handle.
Finely-crafted by Corrupted Artisans to guard the hand when wielding a weapon.
A stitched inner guard for the hilt of the blade.
Cold to the touch, this blade was imbued with the power of icy death.
A sturdy stock of Ironwood to grip when twirling and slashing.
A fish touched by the powers of Corruption.
A pulsating shard from the twisted mind of Isabella De Leon, a tangible piece of her madness.
A sample of midnight black pigment that can be turned into ink.
A carved gemstone in the shape of a dragon of air.
A carved gemstone in the shape of a dragon of water.
A carved gemstone in the shape of a dragon of earth.
A carved gemstone in the shape of a dragon of fire.
A rare purple blossom that is full of new life.
Dark scales removed from an Ebonscale Alligator.
Plans detailing Corrupted movements around Ebonscale.
The reddened innards of the local fauna.
The crimson viscera of the local bird population.
Murky red water filled with a spongy algae.
Flushed bush branches sampled from the Crimson Shallows.
Documents detailing Corrupted battle plans and subterfuge attempts.
A pair of glasses that allow the viewer to see more clearly at a distance.
Wooden samples of the Dryad population of Ebonscale Reach.
Large, sharp teeth that came from a trophy tiger.
A strange box that needs to be broken down to access the contents of.
Orders from a literature trader to move stock of their books across the globe.
A collection of knives and ingredients that Shu-Song needs to work his culinary magic.
Red meat of the bison variety.
A scrumptious meal made of different kinds of seasoned meats.
For opening Dynasty-built cages and setting things free.
Scrolls detailing the family and nobility structures of the Chinese settlers in Ebonscale.
Sharp and probably too dangerous to have at a wedding.
Red strings symbolizing the connection between two spouses.
A thin blue liquid, squeezed from a Dryad's Eye plant.
A shimmering resin with the consistency of thick lacquer.
When coated with Tang Zhi's mixture, a normal Ironwood plank becomes almost unbreakable.
The complex schematics used to rig a cannon for use by a Brute.
Beneath the rust sits a well-designed pistol lock.
A thin sliver of pure platinum, chipped fresh from a vein.
The completed form of Alvaro's redesigned blunderbuss lock.
A strange device meant to be filled and installed within a special blunderbuss.
A powdery substance left when azoth water continually flows.
Flakes and dust of pure gold, chipped fresh from a vein.
When filled, sealed, and installed, this adds power to a special blunderbuss.
The shattered remnants of an Imperial soldier's musket.
Rivets expertly forged from orichalcum, taken from the pirates' spoils.
Blackened armor plating taken from Imperial warriors. It is unclear what caused the tarnishing.
A gummy powder that will supposedly increase the power of a special blunderbuss.
Looks like charcoal, but there's something a bit different about the smell.
Scraps of once-hardy manacles that the Dynasty Corrupted use to capture prisoners.
A flag torn from a forlorn wreck [Mission Item]
A bag of dried fruit, nuts, and trail bread.
A collection of star charts used for navigation at sea
A tightly bound toolbag, filled with quality construction tools.
A crude, but expressive, clay statue.
A (formerly sealed) page of orders, hinting at dark deeds done in Letum's Pick
A small cask filled with gunpowder
The heavy pelt of a Warden Lynx, with soft and luxurious fur.
The pelt of a Brown Rabbit, cleaned and ready to be used.
A pile of charcoal, used to stoke a forge fire.
A small trout, a vital ingredient in making Forellac's jerked fish.
An aromatic jerked fish, great for travel rations.
A simple locket to hold a keepsake. On the front is the finely wrought image of a black hawk.
A glass vial holding a sample of the blood of a Corrupted.
A hunk of grey ore related to iron, but perfect for creating magnets.
A hunk of rotting flesh, stripped from the back of a Withered.
A folded length of cloth, possibly made by the Ancients. It appears undamaged by time.
A scrap of cloth pulled from the bones of a Guardian.
A vial holding a sample of blood from an Undead Pirate.
A four-sided crystal pyramid that appears to trap light instead of dispersing it.
A token claimed from Guardians depicting the Ouroboros, the serpent eating its own tail.
A strange gel that appears to be the remains of a Ghost.
A low-quality pearl, gathered from the Hatchburg Fishery.
A silver-lined flask, supposedly meant to change colors when exposed to poison.
A sliver of stone, dimly glowing with the blue light of azoth.
A collection of locally grown herbs, intended for healing purposes.
Syndicate journals filled with research on a number of topics, from azoth to zoology
An iron blank for arrowheads, blessed by a variety of religious leaders.
A hunter's traveling rations , spoiled by the touch of Corruption.
The remains of a hunter's quarry, tainted by the touch of Corruption.
Freshly harvested barley from the fields of Dayspring Mills
A simple silver charm, with the image of a lighthouse engraved on the front.
A cut semi-precious gem. Along the edge is carved, "For my love, for all eternity.
An old locket, holding a cameo and a twist of hair.
An ornate pomander, holding the pleasant scent of vetiver and rose.
The recipe for a very special brew, held by Chef Paul Giroux
A sack of quality hops, grown and harvested near the Hilltop Encampment
A small and portable distillery, covered in an odorous black sludge.
Flasks holding a thick black liquid. A scrap of paper tied around the neck of each reads "Paul's New Brew."
A collection of tools and parts necessary to keep a cannon functional.
Lucky coin once part of the Vernal Bounty's loot.
Fractured pieces of artifacts that are still worth something.
Well-preserved artifacts, worth a decent price.
Notes from William Heron's previous expedition.
Ancient Relics from Malocchio Spire, worth a good price.
This is some Mossbone Azoth that needs a better description (bug this if you find it in-game).
Documents found inside a secret compartment in the figurehead of Sordamor's Honor.
Protective with a distinct smokey color.
Thin strands of orichalcum are worked into the fibers.
A bottle filled with viscous liquid.
Guaranteed to make no sound while stalking.
Twice as old and twice as strong.
Musky with a hint of forest shadows.
Looks like a slice of the night sky.
Possible location of where the Touched Coin might reside.
Used for making highly explosive bombs.
The original Cutlass Keys Fort plans.
Supplies needed to make a stronger fort.
A fractured blade rumored to have been used by a great pirate.
A grindstone for honing the edge of a blade.
A leather used to wrap around the hilt of a blade.
A sticky, pitch black oil used for quenching blades.
It sounds like a raging river.
Made from Lightning Spirits, it is said to hold back Corruption when it goes off.
Perfect for simmering all types of sauces.
Passed down by generations of Swampy's family.
Perfect for cooking stews for long hours.
Once made stock for an entire ship
Filled with countless recipes, concotions, and tinctures.
Scales shed from a streaked alligator.
Discarded claw from a marsh wildcat.
The tooth of the lion living in Snaggletooth Den.
Whiskers shed from an island leopard.
Used to keep Corrupted animals under control.
Used by the Corrupted to train their animals to obey orders.
From all her talking, over time all Jocelyn's teeth fell out, one by one.
Every detail of her life, written in extremely fine print.
Combined with the rest of the map, this will lead to great treasure!
Overflowing with the wealth of many a raided ship!
Harkening back to happier days when Billiam was at sea.
Still finely tuned to the turning of the stars.
Charts that map the rough seas outside of Aeternum.
A good snack for when you need a little boost.
A mixture of almond flour, walnuts, and poppy seeds.
A perfect sweet treat, and secret ingredient in Janice's cookies.
Winner of the Cutlass Keys Cooking Competition 55 years running.
Cooked just long enough to turn golden brown.
An old weapon, from an older time.
The fanciest watch you've ever laid eyes on in Aeternum.
Who wouldn't like to drink out of a cup of pure gold?
A treasured astrolabe that is more for decoration than guiding.
A spyglass that seems in good condition. Its previous owner took good care of it.
This compass's needle seems to move with some dark energy that is certainly not magnetism.
An ordinary chunk of ore that has been touched by the Corrupted. It pulsates with a dark power.
A raw gem naturally shaped like a teardrop. A few of them will fetch a high price once refined.
Medallions of pure gold with a simple inscription: Lacrimosa dies illa
A golden key used to unlock the Padre's hoard of golden medallions
A smooth orb, made of copper. There are ancient glyphs drawn on the surface.
A polished orb, made of silver. There are ancient glyphs drawn on the surface.
A rough orb, made of stone. There are ancient glyphs drawn on the surface.
Golden mail from the armor of Ancient Guardians.
Tatters of cloth from the armor of Ancient Guardians.
A very ornate spyglass that seems Ancient in origin. It's infused with azoth.
A wooden totem emanating a dark energy. It was held by the Corrupted.
Barnacles encrust this scrappy Hurdy Gurdy.
A waterlogged diary, filled with unintelligable scrawl.
An Ancient object bedecked in strange markings. Could it perhaps be a key?
An odd fragment of Ancient sculpture.
An odd fragment of Ancient sculpture.
An odd fragment of Ancient sculpture.
A note to the bartender from Leilani.
A Juicy cut of Hibbotsfeld Style BBQ Pork.
A fine cut of Mourningdale Pork.
A fine cut of Mourningdale Pork.
A fine cut of Mourningdale Pork.
A breastplate, scarred from hard battle.
A nicely worked helmet in an older style.
A flag torn from a forlorn wreck [Mission Item]
A chest of well-used weapons that are waterlogged and falling apart
Despite a little dirt and the stench of the Withered, this squash appears to be perfectly healthy.
A foul-smelling gallbladder that still contains some bile.
A perfectly healthy ear of corn. Looks delicious.
Pieces of silk fabric that have been ripped in a struggle. They're perfect for crafty patchwork.
A crate of squashes that are unblemished and glowing. Who says you can't keep the rest for yourself?
The shade and soil of Arruda Ranch makes the best rhubarb jam. It is a treat in Monarch's Bluffs.
Low quality weapons that, despite light use, are completely destroyed. To have used them in battle would have been a death wish.
A weathered brooch adorned with precious gems. This belongs to a prominent family in Windsward.
A large ruby known as a Bloody Heart. It throbs and pulses rhythmically.
An artifact of the Ancients. Artificer Gomes will be interested in it greatly.
An artifact of the Ancients. Artificer Gomes will be interested in it greatly.
A chunk of ore that has been soaked with blood. This will certainly pique Commander Purcell's interest.
Sea water tinted with trace amounts of azoth. A reminder of the sea that has a kick.
A fine powder that's often used in alchemic experiments. Like salt, just a pinch goes a long way.
Oil infused with Azoth that's often used in alchemic experiments. Alchemist Tuit will be glad to see this.
A crystal cluster, tinted by azoth, that has a brilliant shine. Adjudicator Owgan will be pleased with these.
A rusty ring of keys claimed from a Siltboot Grenadier.
A charm once held dearly. The memories tied to this charm must be bittersweet.
Honey taken from Devil's Quarry. They say a spoonful satisfies the body and sunders the soul.
A flask of wine made to be concealed like a dagger, used often by the crew of The Dagger.
Wine concealed in a gourd-shaped jug. The sailors of The Grey Mist used these jugs to represent luck.
A notebook filled with complex calculations, notes, and architectural sketches
A flask of fresh Withered blood
A long bone, pulled from the body of a defeated Withered
A bundle of nettles retrieved from the dirt of a gravesite
An ornate compass with silver inlay, engraved with the letters 'GA'
A small stone that soothes, calms, and protects
A thick ooze that resists even being placed in a container
A gem once held by an Ancient Guardian, etched with a protective sigil
A vial of water collected from pools near starmetal deposits
A lead weight on a line, used to ensure proper vertical lines on structures
The remains of the smashed runed tablet. The stone is brittle, like a sandstone.
A chunk that fell off the mysterious altar in Traitor's Hold. The altar seemed to have lost its power, but this piece still resonates with a faint energy.
This weapon seems exceptionally well-made, with treated wood and polished bronze adorning the chassis.
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a crane.
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a hawk.

Thick as an oak branch and twice as tough to draw.

"Fear me not. Fear what comes in my wake."
Survivors of Varangian raids claim their gun smoke takes the shape of leering skulls, but that is probably the blood loss talking.
Legate Crassus was so impressed with these weapons he ordered their immediate production for his legion.

May it the last thing your enemies hear.
A Musket this old shouldn't exist! Another mystery of this disturbing place.
"Fury can make one brash. Rage makes one focused."
"Mercy fades as the dusklight wanes. What cruelties will you inflict upon those that wander in your shadow?"
"The Siren's haunting voice echoes in your mind, calling out in a language of emotion everyone understands."

"A weapon of justice and holy intent turned into a weapon of malice."
A little bit of acid goes a long way in softening up a dangerous target.
"Just how big is the alchemical pot that requires a stirring rod this large? And why does this spear seem to soak up half of the reagents?"
"Come, the revolution has begun! Grab your spears and pitchforks and let us storm the keep!"
“Throughout history we have seen one continued method of solving all problems. Violence.”
"Welcome to Aeternum, where your demise is just around the corner!"
"Killing Dryads is oh so fun. And now with this spear you can do it faster than ever!"
Blessed by Bast, and consecrated in the Temple of Shu, this legendary artifact was thought to be lost to graverobbers forever.
"Karl never gave orders without having his Appointed Negotiator around. It never failed to stop arguments before they started."
"Aeternum is an archaeologist's paradise with ruins galore to explore."
"Mages specialize in a variety of magics, but those who favor frost have found spears to be an effective conduit for their spells."
"Brimming with pure azoth infusion, this spear is bursting at the seams with raw energy."
The difference between living and dying is as thin as the tip of the spear.
It doubles as the world's most expensive walking stick.
"…So I turned around and pinned him to a wall with this!"
"Blight is the Dryad's most hated enemy. Let this weapon guide you to their death."
"A cruel ceremony, the blood eagle is fit only for the lowest of the low."
"I never wanted this, and yet I was born to rule. So rule I shall."
"The ancient Javelineer moved his spear so effortlessly it was like a part of his body."
"This spear was crafted by dark engineers on the other side of the veil."
"The tip glistens beautifully when it catches the light."
Held by members of an elite guard unit.
"It seems as if it will break the second you strike something with it."
"Hit their ship from the side! Thrust your spears into the wood of their ship, board it, and slay them all!"
"The ship crashed into the rocky shore of Aeternum shattering the hull and the mast. Survivors quickly scrambled to gather whatever weapon they could as they faced the Drowned on the shores."

"It was once tradition to bury the dead with a weapon so that they could defend themselves in the afterlife. Of course, that tradition stopped once the dead would get right back up and begin fighting you with that weapon."
"Throw me and see where I land."
“The monster lashed out, striking its creators down with a single blow.”
"Far more than a ceremonial weapon, this ranseur was honed sharp and used often."
"Every strike causes confusion. Every use leads to upheaval."
"My royal subjects, I ask that you assist me in the conquest of this land in the name of the Tempest."
Witness the beauty of the flames, streaking across the sky with each swipe.
"Shatter the walls and storm the keep, this city shall fall."
"A brave captain, beloved by all who knew him. Like all the others, he too succumbed to the alure of corruption."
"The corrupted do not treat us as humans. They see us only as pigs to be slaughtered."
"Your dark rebirth shall grant you powers beyond your comprehension."
"A spear reserved for the glorious adjudicator's of the Covenant."
A Spear reserved for newcomers to the Covenant.
"A spear reserved for followers of the Covenant who have proved themselves loyal to the cause."
A well-made spear for newly-inducted Covenant Initiates.
A well-made spear for Covenant Templars.
A well-made spear for Covenant Excubitors.
A well-made spear for Covenant Lumens.
A well-made spear for Covenant Adjudicators.
"A spear reserved for devoute followers of the Covenant whose actions have brought glory to the cause."
A Spear reserved for Covenant who have reached the rank of Templar.
"Give me a name and I shall deliver you a skull."
"The head of a spear is an odd use for such a precious gem, though I suppose it is rather sharp."
"Spar with me and I will let you rest for eternity."
A sturdy spear any soldier can rely on.
"Useful for climbing steep hills or fending off unwanted companions."
The serrated edge helps to rend the tough hides of large foes.
"The truly elite soldiers of the Dynasty forces are their spearman. Their agile movements and unbreakable will made them a deadly force poised to conquer any who stood in their way."
"Coated in a fine poison. Pain is all your enemies shall know."
"Perfect for spear fishing against small fish, sharks, and whales. Though maybe don't try to take down a kraken with this."
"Many a hunter tried to take down Odious Belam, but only one came close, armed with this spear."
Due to the time spent within eternal voids, this weapon has mutated to better suit its eternal prison.
"If dragons ever did exist in their land, then surely this weapon is forged from one of their claws. The sheer size of such a claw speaks to the possibility."
"Beautiful flowers and vines adorn every corner of this weapon. It is as enchanting as it is deadly."
"I lost most of my crew when I came to Aeternum. But the loss that hurt the most was that of my dear dog. While she came back like all things do here, she was... different."
"Bandits descended on the farm, prepared to steal all the farmer had worked to grow. She gripped her trusty friend and prepared to fight."
"Gaze into my crystals and see your future."
"To become a grandmaster spearman requires decades of training and dedication. When one achieves such an unparalleled feat they are given a spear crafted by the finest artisans of Aeternum."
"A standard issue pike for the royal guard, the craftsmanship of this weapon is immaculate."
"Snap a Dryad in half, sharpen it to a point and you have made yourself a pike!"
"Keep the Dryads at an arms reach, for they are lethal creatures."
"Do not let this land rip from you who you are."
"Lightning cracks from the spear as it is thrown, jutting out in every direction."
"Ancient scientists cared little for conflict, but they found weapons useful to further their research."
"Ripped from the front of a crashed galleon, this spearhead is perfect for boarding ships and slaying enemies."
This branch was torn from the tree before it could finish blossoming.
"This pike seems more focused on appearing beautiful than it does being an effective weapon."
"The shaft of this spear is covered in gnarled roots, perfect for the harsh starmetal tip to embed itself in."
"The inscription is muddled but you can make out the words "Morigos" and "Archmage". When you wield the spear it seems to speak to you."
"Graverobbing, ever the risky business. If you aren't well equipped, surely the competition will be."
"The executioner jammed the spear into his prisoner's abdomen, ripping out his entrails."
If you should die before you wake...
If you should die before you wake...
An odyssean spear whose form was handed down by the Ancient Guardians. Wrought from the Underworld, it is the spear that pierced the heavens.
"To learn to rule is no easy task."
Due to the time spent within hellfire, this weapon has mutated to better suit its hellish prison.
"Free us from the bonds of hell and give us life anew."
"Look beyond the curtain, not all is as it may seem."
"For all the horrors the townsfolk may see during the day, what comes at night is far worse than what they can imagine."
"The great Sentinel Holm kept watch over the revered tower Malocchio for generations, and it was the pride of the sentinel that led to the towers stagnation."
"The massive size of this weapon makes it unwieldy to wield for humans, yet perfect for the forces of the Corrupted."
"The spearhead vibrates as you move the spear from side to side."
Due to the time spent within frozen worlds, this weapon has mutated to better suit its frostbitten prison.
"The glacial freeze is difficult to break up. In my years of exploration I've found that quick and powerful jabs yield the most consistent results."
"I shall ascend the ramparts or I shall perish. There is no other choice."
"The tip of the spear is coated with broken shards of glass, creating a mean and vile weapon that seeks to inflict pain more than it seeks to kill."
"The Greenkeeper was charged with guarding the most sacred of places to the Dryads. The spread of blight into such a sanctuary does not bode well for their kind."
"Hooks adorn the edge of the spear's head, allowing it to remain stuck inside any victim."
"Imbued within this weapon is the memory of a thousand Dryads. Their knowledge is now yours to command."
"Weather the storm in your heart and find peace within."
"Before she was turned by the power of corruption, she was a warrior of great renown. After she was turned, her visage imbued fear into the hearts of all who had the misfortune to come upon her."
"The vanguard of the corrupted forces are a fearsome lot. When they descend upon an army, none are left alive."
"Jousting is an older art, but it still requires years of training before you have any shot of competing in a tournament."
"How do you find out what rustles in the brush? Stab it."
"The jungles are my domain. Enter if you dare."
And with this spear the waters flow, pouring over the land.
"The world changes when the sun dips below the horizon. Things that sleep during the day begin to lurk at night. Carry this weapon with you so that you might see the sun rise again."
Taken from the bones of fallen beast, and used to slay its kin.
"The cycle of life binds us all."
"Slain by her own spear, Leandra would rather die than serve in the corrupted legions."
A regal spear once believed lost to the sands of time.
"In the heart of a storm, lightning seems drawn to this weapon."
"Your enemies will be shocked by your power."
“Perhaps if you infuse this weapon with enough shadow energy it will transform.”
An important piece of a long forgotten dance, yet lethal it remains.
"This weapon has a mind of its own, wriggling and writhing as the life inside it hungers for flesh."
"Dusty and crusty, this spear was left in a Guardian armory for centuries. Despite the wear and tear, the point of the spear is as sharp as ever."
"Nothing in this life is beyond your grasp."
"Thrust the spear into the ground and let loose the fires of hell."
"Flowing with pure magical energy, this spear draws power from the sources around it."
"A spear reserved for feared commanders of the Marauders."
A Spear reserved for newcomers to the Marauders.
"A spear reserved for soldiers of the Marauders who have proved themselves loyal to the cause."

Its heat will be comforting in the Deep.
Used by many vile fiends to hold down their prey so it can be corrupted for evil benefits.
Due to the time spent within nature, this weapon has mutated to better suit its natural prison.
"What is yours shall soon belong to The Taker."
"Originally used for hunting animals, over time it became something that struck fear into the hearts of people and animals alike."
"The Corrupted Keeper kept watch over this citadel for generations. Thousands felt his wrath."
Oranath, Spear of the Corrupted Servant
"An overconfident mage once tried to teach an ogre to use a wand. The ogre quickly discarded the wand and killed the mage, but what remains seems to be functional as a spear."
"May this spear be a plague upon those who would do you wrong."
"When thrown this javelin appears as if a flaming phoenix soaring through the sky."
"Perfect for hunting boar and roasting them afterwards."
"Duels are a popular past time in Aeternum. The impermenance of death allows fighters to give each duel their all without a regard for their life."
"She wanders the wilds with a spear at her side, though she dares not draw it unless challenged."
"The hunt is on, and the cure is gone."
The strength of an ocean storm will ravage all that is around the wielder.
The proverbial spearhead of the formation cannot breakdown.
An ancient weapon that any soldier can rely upon.
An ancient weapon that any soldier can rely upon.

An ancient weapon that any soldier can rely upon.
One of the oldest and most reliable forms of weaponry still holds its worth.

One of the oldest and most reliable forms of weaponry still holds its worth.
A well-made weapon. It will serve you as well as it served its previous wielder.
This modified hunting spear provides a deceptive sense of security in a dangerous land.
"I had lost hope in humanity, but you have restored it."
"Apostate Luca created this spear to lance all impurities out of the world."
"When the earth quakes my fury shall come for you."
"Every jab imparts a unique flavor of pain, carefully procured by Corlew."
“Previously wielded by the elite Sentinel Captain of the Ancient Guardians.”
"Despite all of the atrocities she has committed, Isabella was once human like us."
"Dents and cracks line the bone of this once great beast, yet the tip is sharpened to a fine and lethal point."
"The shattered husk of a once venerable weapon, this spear has been reforged anew. Though it has lost some of its power, your foes would still be wise to fear you."
A sturdy Lance, wielded by Shizaru The Storm.
"As a pirate I visited a thousand evils on my prey. On this forsaken island a thousand deaths I suffered in pennance."
"As a pirate I visited a thousand evils on my prey. On this forsaken island a thousand deaths I suffered in pennance."
"At one point or another this weapon was thrust into a fire leaving a long charred scar across the shaft."
"To spar with the Siren Queen is the highest honor she grants to her subjects. Few are invited, and fewer leave her arena alive."
"How many countless souls were stolen by this weapon and damned to a torment worse than death?"
"Suffering does not stop when you die. You are simply reborn to suffer all over again."
"The realm of death is mine to command, but its denizens are yours to do with as you will."
"Every time you die in this strange land a piece of you fades away. Die enough times... well, all that remains at that point is the memory of what you once were."
"First she broke my heart, then she ripped out my soul."
"They came for us as the sun dipped below the horizon. The red glow of their priests danced upon the trees. When night finally came, they descended upon our walls."
"The mage toyed with me for hours, experimenting with all forms of magic to torture me. When he let his guard down for but a moment, I seized my opportunity and thrust my spear into his heart."
"Magic is not limited to the arcane. What strange magics the Dryads of Reekwater wield is just as potent as that of the Ancients."
"The first snow of each year is the most beautiful. A shame it needs to be coated with your blood."
"Ride atop your horse and seek out your prey."

"For ages kings and queens have sought power. When news of Aeternum began to circulate the Old World, some rulers were bold enough to venture to this new land themselves. Their subjects never saw them again."
"The outer isles of Aeternum are rich in Azoth making them a desired destination for would-be explorers."
"Few souls have ever wileded a spear like the Praetorian Guard. Their talent was unmatched and their fervor was relentless."
"Let the rage course through your veins."
"Darkness spreads across the land slowly but steadily, corrupting whatever may be in its path."
"A well placed spear can strike between the warped and tangled wood that spriggans use for armor.
"The black shadow brews, full of menace"
"Why bring the storm to others when you can bring the storm to you?"
"A haunting melody that makes your hair stand on end, your mouth taste of metal, and your skin tingle."
"Even in the heat of the sun this spear remains frozen solid."
"May my point strike as true as the first drops of sunlight on the morning dew."
With a new day come new radiant possibilities.
"A spear reserved for the most cunning alchemists of the Syndicate."

"A spear reserved for agents of the Syndicate who have proved themselves loyal to the cause."

"I urge you my friends, do not get your hopes up. This island has a way of crushing them."
"Throw ration and reason out the window and let passion make your choices for you."
"The song of the Tempest lures many to this land. Her unbridled fury is what keeps so many here."

"When delving in ruins it is wise to carry a large weapon."
"The spear still tinges with the touch of the void, maintaining some sort of connection to the other side of the corrupted breaches."

Subtle hints of life crawl all across the wood.
"The fine point shines in the light of the stars."
"What are you being executed for? Nothing more than my pleasure."
"The prophecy speaks of a champion who shall one day be worthy to wield this spear and bring balance to the world."
"Strike down the veil that separates us from them. Let corruption run wild through this world."
"Overgrowth has replaced a considerable amount of the wood that once formed the shaft of this spear."
"I will show you the error of your ways."
"Pure darkness radiates from the spear, a sort of hunger that thirsts for conquest."
"Let the tendrils of the void reach into your heart."
"My power shall rush over you as a wave rushes over a shell."
"Dryad's are like a weed upon the land. You must kill them while they're small or they'll spread and ruin it all."
"Blubber is thick, but my spear is sharp."
"Once belonged to a warrior who terrorized a village. Mysteriously, a collosal stone one day fell upon her head."
“If a weapon could have a joyous personality, this spear surely would.”

"Master shamans spend years in training, going through several staves as they perfect their craft."
"No matter how broken you are, you can be pieced back together."
"Crossing the ocean is a daunting task even with the finest crew. Keep a well trained medic on board for the injuries you are sure to sustain."
"Simple and elegant, this small piece of wood holds untold powers."
"Sirens are strange creatures. They sing songs of death, yet wield a staff of life?"
"What joy is there in this world?"
"The crystals in the staff hum and sing a song that soothes your heart."
"How many souls are trapped within this staff? Too many to count."
"Some poor soul was siphoned from her body and trapped in this staff, yearning for release."
"The most noble souls burn the brightest."
"With this weapon you must stand against darkness lest it consume us all."
"Spirits stew so that great power may come forth."
"You sense the spirit of the spriggan lying dormant within the staff."
"I am the sacred female. The giver of life."
"For all their marvelous creations, the magic artifacts left by the Ancients are among the most splendid objects to be found in Aeternum."
"The fiends spread their vile blight everywhere they go. Even this weapon is covered in the disease."
"Do not delve into the caverns for you do not know what horrors await you."
"Let your enemies feel your magic like a bolt of lightning jolting through their body."
"You may mourn for me, and then you shall avenge me."
"Succumb to the void and let yourself be free."
"Justice is not often this black and white."
"Your soul shall be mine to wield."
"People get what is coming to them."
"Be still my child as I tend to your wounds."
"Do you hear them? The whispers all around us?"
"A grave sadness overtakes you as you wield this staff, along with a sense of duty to set right the injustices that you find."
"Dark forces run wild in the caverns of Amrine Temple. Only the light can purge them."
"Submerse yourself and let out your breath. When my waters fill your lungs, you shall be pure."
"My decision is clear. All shall serve the will of the Tempest."
"Fit for royalty, this staff belonged to several generations of court sorcerers."
"The dark prophet traveled aeternum spreading tales of the power of corruption, enticing weak souls to join his cause."
"Peer into the abyss and see that which has no end."
"You dishonor all mankind with what you have done."
"What little life you have left I shall rip from your body as I throw you into the fires below."
"A fire rages within you. Do not let it burn too hot, lest it consume all that you are."
"Come, your slumber must end. We have work to do."
The staff of the mother who protects this land.
"With this weapon I shall unmake you."
"Travel the wilds and heal that which is ailing."
"This weapon appears to be a rock ripped from a cavern and blessed with holy magic."
"The stars shine brightest when there is good being done."
"Be still and let your body heal."
"A soul rattles around inside the staff, begging for freedom. In quiet times you hear its screams."
"I call upon the elements to strike down my enemy!"
"A beacon in a storm, to guide those ill to health again."

Small blades that should be carries by every good soldier for day-to-day tasks.

A satchel with various sacred implements and consecrated items used as part of some type of ritual.

Notes regarding weaponsmithing techniques. Improve your Weaponsmithing trophy with this.
An Amulet worn by heroic Soulwarden Constanza Suberria
These boots have padded soles to help one walk around without scaring the fishes.
a bow crafted from wood from one of the Angry Earth realms.
This medium-weigth armor is especially stout against Corruption.
Arcane ingredients used in crafting potions that defend against Corruption.
An assortment of concoctions to help battle Corruption.
A great axe with a bite to match its goulishly wicked bark.
The helm of one who persists steadfastly in the face of adversity
A blade forged to serve the Soulwardens
A shield, centuries old, used by Soulwarden Cristina Krempel.
A beacon of hope for the vulnerable of Everfall.
A warm coat, crafted for you by Odnell Lee.
Sometimes acquiring raegents takes a little dirty work, and this is the perfect tool for the job.
An opulent headpiece with a surface so finely polished your foes will see their reflection in it before you strike them down.
Its shots are infused with an Ancient power that lets it tear through bone.
Nothing can uproot its bearer, allowing them to stand strong against the most formidable Ancient foes.
You sense a deep anger emenating from the staff, though you can't discern what its angry about.
Although crafted to bring her luck, these pants still couldn't help Tamra's clumsiness
This aged staff derives its healing powers from a long forgotten Ancient power.
One fell swing is enough to reduce bones to a hundred pieces.
This hatchet slices through the dangerous tendrils of the Corrupted with ease.
Reinforced against the raging evil of the Corruption, these gloves imbue confidence in its wearer.
Radiating icy intensity, this gauntlet is perfect for serving a cold dish of revenge.
A hearty chestpiece that once protected the Corrupted Lietenants you felled. Tekla cleaned it for you.
Everything you need to start playing the Azoth Flute.
Everything you need to start playing the Guitar.
Everything you need to start playing the Upright Bass and Mandolin

A bundle of pelts prepared for you by Odnell Lee for slaying Grizzlmaw.
A precise, creaking bow. Legends say it was once wielded by a Lost Pirate of the same name.
Ready to drag you home after a long night in the tavern.
The deafening boom of this weapon strikes fear in even the most weathered sailors.
Close inspection of this gauntlet reveals intricate diagrams of constellations embossed on its surface.
While no longer useful for performing alchemy, it has been repurposed to offer protection.
An assortment of arcane ingredients used in crafting potions.
A selection of elixir samples concocted by Anwir Hughes.

A weapon formerly wielded by Soulwarden Romanos Agallon.

A magical talisman that helps protect its wearer
Equip this handsome leather bag to increase your carrying capacity.

A pair of serviceable leather boots.

A robust piece of chest armor.

A healthy cache of gold coin.
Bring this fire staff aboard ship, and ye too may end up stranded
Lightweight gloves that enable a deft touich
Tough, if somewhat plain leather gloves.
A massive blade for dealing out sacred justice
This circlet signifies its wearer's integrity
A basket full of fresh ingredients for cooking
A sturdy blade that will serve its owner well.
The heavy leg armor of a Knight
Lightweight leggings that won't hamper your movement
These leg coverings offer decent protection.
Many a miner has made their living thanks to such a tool.
A selection of potions to aid in your adventures.
A selection of very useful potions
This regeneration potion has a mellow bouquet and a lively finish.
What it lacks in precision, this rapier makes up with character.
Not quite the belle of the ball, but she's a sturdy one
A gift from Edda Koning for help discovering Eddie's fate.
Sturdy gloves that dampen the harsh blows of pickaxe against stone.
Whispers of the Lost dance on the chill winds that this gauntlet produces.
Agile boots that once belonged to Fatimah. They radiate mild magical energy.
It draws healing power from the emphathy felt by its wielder.
Heavy boots worn by the now Lost Knights of Shatterwall.
The wounds it leaves resemble bitemarks of a large beast.
Beautiful glasswork made by Olivia Barovier's father. An unknown power keeps it from shattering when fired.
Fatimah's favorite hat. She no longer needs it.
A symbol of faith. Crafted by Dayo Musa to protect the bearer.
A humble but strong piece of legwear that many great knights began with.
A handful of honey infused treats that Geertle Lother prepared for you.
An important tool in the winemaking process.
Deft gloves that lets the wearer harvest more easily.

A suitable weapon for skewering men or manatee.

A Standard Repair Kit. Fully repairs any Tier 2 item.

A Master Repair Kit. Fully repairs any Tier 5 item.

Short-grain rice. Good for soups, stews, porridges…even desserts.
"Once etched with delightful patterns of leaping fish, now the patterns are worn by time and barely visible."
"Some obligations are never forgotten. Especially by those they were promised to."
Rewarded for completing the quest, 'Blessings of Earth'.
"Hard fought, foul foes. From whence they came? No one knows."
"Hard fought, foul foes. From whence they came? No one knows."
"Hard fought, foul foes. From whence they came? No one knows."
A reward for getting William Heron the Armillary Sphere.
Rewarded for completing the quest, 'Ancient Protections'.
"No one gives this ring with cruel intentions."
"And with this ring a promise is made, to call upon those when the time is right."
"Beware the Herald when he points at you. For it is then that you know you have been forsaken."
Earned for defending humanity against the invading forces of corruption.
Earned for defending humanity against the invading forces of corruption.
Earned for defending humanity against the invading forces of corruption.
"Wearing this invokes a feeling of never being full, of always needing something more."
"Antonio's life was filled with so many adventures. Sadly, none were etched into this ring."
"The memory of all the good works of Hazel swirls through this ring, giving the wearer a feeling of hope."
"Jason had insisted on just one more trip out to sea. It was to prove his undoing, as he ended up on Aeternum."
"There are voices swirling around this ring, which you can almost make out. They hint at things you don't wish to think about."
"Stephen was never seen without this ring, though no one bothered to ask why while he was living."
"Let the wild places flourish without a guiding hand, let the forests grow rampant to cover the land."
Earned through stalwart action in outpost contests.
Earned through stalwart action in outpost contests.
"Only truth can stop propergration of false ideas."

"Once buried as part of a collection to ward off a section of the graveyard, it was dug up by Padre Nunez who said he didn't believe in such superstitious nonsense."
"The wild hart cannot be tamed by trickets or baubles. But that does not mean people haven't tried."
As you sleep the ring on, your hair stands on end.
"The symbol upon this signet is a sign of three reeds, heads bowed as if by some unfelt breeze."
Simon's ring appears to be fashioned from small silver baubles found on his travels.
Despite losing all that made her human, the Siren Queen kept this ring close to her as a keepsake of what she once was.
A ring worn by the Siren Queen.
It's slimy. It's wood. It's gross. It's powerful.
"A fallen leaf from the sword tree."
A ring made from some kind of large animal bone.

Sparks fly from the surface of this ring when even lightly grazed by metal.
A ring fashioned from the roots of a Spriggan.

"It feels warm in your hand, pulsing a kind of oppressive heat that almost smells of sulfur."
"A fallen angel makes for a monstrous bearer of sacrifice."
“A staff imbued with restorative primordial forces.”
“A lance blessed to maintain the balance of light and darkness.”
Mars himself shed a tear at the sheer carnage of such a weapon.
Reveal the destinies of those who would cross you.
The members of the Solanum genus are deadly for their poisons, best distributed through their prickly thorns.
Is that the low, discordant note of a bass or a blast of shrapnel in your enemy's side?
Rise from the ashes to shoot down your foes.
Whether you're in a duel or death match, this blunderbuss portends death wherever it points.
The large crystal seems to give each shot some extra 'oomph'. Though where the energy is coming from you can't say…
The Sagittarii would be proud of such a weapon.
Aim straight and true, for the power of the dragon is with you.
Two scarabs reach out their crawlers to guide and empower the arrows shot forth.
Festoon your prey with festive arrows and deck the halls with your trophies.
"To split an arrow in two is one thing, to split an enemy is another."
An arrow notched and released from a bow of superior gold and emeralds wounds egos as well as bodies.
From the maw of the skulls comes an arrow sure to make your enemy quiver.
"These arrows find a home in the heart of an enemy and their bruised imprint stays there forevermore."
"Strung with reinforced vines, this bow is as virid as it is deadly."
While it would arguably be better used as a melee weapon, even that would take an incredible amount of skill.
Draw upon the power of the void.
By the time you notice the telltale cough and red spots it's already too late.
Invested in both song and appearance, the wearer finds they want it that way.
When your wit is as sharp as your blades, you can take whatever you please in Aeternum.
The embroidered garb of those seeking mastery in Aeternum's arcane forces.
A blue dream of tomorrow framed in gingham.
With the insight of the God of Power all secrets of the sands can be revealed.
Imbued with the might of the lion goddess, there is no enemy you cannot overcome.
Carved in onyx, this armor teems with the power of the chief embalmer.
Signal to all who dare turn their gaze upon you that you are indeed the ruler of the desert.
Dispel darkness and intimidate evil in this thrice-toughened heavy armor.
Wear this graceful light armor to dodge circles around your enemies.
Feel the fervor of your patron raging through your mortal veins.
The star shines on, bathing Aeternum in the golden light of redemption.
Imbued with the shining powers of the crescent moon, lighting up Aeternum just as the lunar surface does at night.
This ensemble will add some much needed class to an otherwise simple wardrobe.
Let loose a roar that shakes the foundations of Aeternum.
The armor seems to sculpt itself against the wearer's body like a second skin for ultimate stealth.
Bark as thick and heavy as stone rests on the skin of the wearer, granting them superior immunity.
The veins of plants unknown cling to this armor, pulsing with life.
Become the ruler of all things verdant and green in this root-wrapped set.
Proof you've outsmarted the devil himself in a fiddle play-off.
Devil Went Down To Aeternum Breastplate
Because you're not hardcore unless you live hardcore.
Be the diehard hero of the Medleyfaire with this intimidating style.
For those unafraid of getting their gloves dirty with the salt of the earth.
Outshine, outwit, and bring your opponents to their knees.
As it is said, they flock together.
As the pyre burns higher, so too does your spirit of battle within.
"One last thing before you go… your purse."
A customary set of armor usually meant for reserve troops.
Let out the rage that burns deep within your heart.
Soar into battle to protect what is rightfully yours.
Made of the finest Mourningdale wool, this tunic and cape shift silently as the ranger prowls the wilds.
With only your eyes exposed to the elements, look upon the dunes of sand and chart your course to victory.
Your worst nightmare come alive to haunt the battlefields of Aeternum.
Made of the finest studded leather in Aeternum it is equally protective as it is silent in movement.
What looks at first to be a large bird running at you will be your untimely demise.
Cloaked in red and gold, the specter of the grave seeks hearts to collect.
Formed in the molten-hot forges of the Great Cleave this avatar of hatred rises, gold and glittering.
Bound by the storm that brought you to Aeternum, you have carved out a name for yourself on the island.
Dripping in scales and gold, this defines the wearer's summertime elegance.
A practical set of fishing attire bearing a royal violet accent.
For those who find themselves lost in frequent bouts of admiration and swooning.
Upon donning this armor, your chest swells with the urge to protect the innocent, the unguarded, and the lovers of the world.

No wolf dare challenge you or Grandma now.

Let the chains rattle with the force of your drumsticks.
Drum to the rhythm of Aeternum's beating heart.

Send your cast soaring through the air.

For precious metals and all manners of ore in Brimstone Sands.

Shines as brightly as the sun in the sky.

This gilded axe glitters and gleams with the glory of the season.
It's imbued with magic to weigh more when striking a foe.
To slice, dice, and chop your victim to bits.
"Hack and slash through the vegetation of Aeternum in style."
The curved blade seems to be getting longer with every slain foe.
Draw upon the power of the void.
By the time you notice the telltale cough and red spots it's already too late.
Invested in both song and appearance, the wearer finds they want it that way.
When your wit is as sharp as your blades, you can take whatever you please in Aeternum.
The embroidered garb of those seeking mastery in Aeternum's arcane forces.
A blue dream of tomorrow framed in gingham.
With the insight of the God of Power all secrets of the sands can be revealed.
Imbued with the might of the lion goddess, there is no enemy you cannot overcome.
Carved in onyx, this armor teems with the power of the chief embalmer.
Signal to all who dare turn their gaze upon you that you are indeed the ruler of the desert.
Dispel darkness and intimidate evil in this thrice-toughened heavy armor.
Wear this graceful light armor to dodge circles around your enemies.
Feel the fervor of your patron raging through your mortal veins.
The star shines on, bathing Aeternum in the golden light of redemption.
Imbued with the shining powers of the crescent moon, lighting up Aeternum just as the lunar surface does at night.
This ensemble will add some much needed class to an otherwise simple wardrobe.
Let none deny your beautiful hair... or lack thereof.
Let loose a roar that shakes the foundations of Aeternum.
The armor seems to sculpt itself against the wearer's body like a second skin for ultimate stealth.
Bark as thick and heavy as stone rests on the skin of the wearer, granting them superior immunity.
The veins of plants unknown cling to this armor, pulsing with life.
Become the ruler of all things verdant and green in this root-wrapped set.
Proof you've outsmarted the devil himself in a fiddle play-off.
Devil Went Down To Aeternum Heavy Helm
Because you're not hardcore unless you live hardcore.
Be the diehard hero of the Medleyfaire with this intimidating style.
For those unafraid of getting their gloves dirty with the salt of the earth.
Outshine, outwit, and bring your opponents to their knees.
As it is said, they flock together.
As the pyre burns higher, so too does your spirit of battle within.
The Flame of your dedication burns bright within you.
"One last thing before you go… your purse."
A customary set of armor usually meant for reserve troops.
Let out the rage that burns deep within your heart.
Soar into battle to protect what is rightfully yours.
Made of the finest Mourningdale wool, this tunic and cape shift silently as the ranger prowls the wilds.
With only your eyes exposed to the elements, look upon the dunes of sand and chart your course to victory.
Your worst nightmare come alive to haunt the battlefields of Aeternum.
Made of the finest studded leather in Aeternum it is equally protective as it is silent in movement.
What looks at first to be a large bird running at you will be your untimely demise.
Cloaked in red and gold, the specter of the grave seeks hearts to collect.
Formed in the molten-hot forges of the Great Cleave this avatar of hatred rises, gold and glittering.
Bound by the storm that brought you to Aeternum, you have carved out a name for yourself on the island.
Dripping in scales and gold, this defines the wearer's summertime elegance.
A practical set of fishing attire bearing a royal violet accent.
For those who find themselves lost in frequent bouts of admiration and swooning.
Upon donning this armor, your chest swells with the urge to protect the innocent, the unguarded, and the lovers of the world.
True art is never understood in its own time.
The resplendent uniform of Death itself, said to stalk every battlefield in Aeternum cursing the island's resurrections.
Rising from the dark and twisting sea, a deadly wave crashes ashore.
No wolf dare challenge you or Grandma now.
By gleam of gem, finery of fur, and glamour of vivid color, one revels and fights back the chill of the darkest nights of the year.
In the dead of winter, even the most practical hunter dons their finest colors before seeking the light and warmth of the season's festival.
One cuts a distinctive silhouette in the season's gloom as folk gather for celebratory processions.
Cloaked in the furs of the wood, the trapper melds into their surroundings.
The cold grasp of death seems almost comedic when juxtaposed to such a bright weapon.
Only the hardiest of flower can survive the icy-cold this gauntlet radiates.
In the crackle of the forming ice, one can hear the jolly cackle of a dandy demon.
Suddenly all is dark and cold, opponent felled by an icicle to the back.
"Not all forms of love require the flames of passion."
"Inscribed with frost runes, this gauntlet chills anything it touches."
The hand of an unfortunate explorer was repurposed after they froze in the cold hells.
It's been strengthened from the many breaches it has closed.
"It uses magic to bob the hook just a little bit. Fish seem to love it."
"Never made an alloy out of azoth, but sure, I'll give it a try."
It may not look like it, but magic courses through this tool.
The soft blue glow makes you feel like you really fit in at a magical forest.
"I ordered a skinning knife from you, not an assassin's knife."
Tough enough to handle even the most dangerous breaches.
The extra reinforcements mean you'll never need to worry about your rod snapping.
"A tool ought to be cared for, but make it out of the right stuff, and you won't have to for a long time."
Tough enough to mine anything you need in Aeternum.
Keeping a sharp edge for a long time makes this sickle extremely practical.
Tough enough to tear through even Yeti hide.
This wand hums with power and is always cool to the touch, even if put to the flame.
There is something about this fishing rod, a glimmer or reverberation, that tempts fish with a deadly and impossible attraction.
The constantly adjusting balance and counterweight of this axe improves one’s chopping form to rote perfection.
By the perfectly pitched chimes of this striking pick, one can identify the minerals they strike in the dark.
This vibrating blade seems to guide the hand to crops most ready for the reaping.
With barely a thought, this supernal blade parts all matter.
Draw upon the power of the void.
By the time you notice the telltale cough and red spots it's already too late.
