By gleam of gem, finery of fur, and glamour of vivid color, one revels and fights back the chill of the darkest nights of the year.
In the dead of winter, even the most practical hunter dons their finest colors before seeking the light and warmth of the season's festival.
One cuts a distinctive silhouette in the season's gloom as folk gather for celebratory processions.
Cloaked in the furs of the wood, the trapper melds into their surroundings.
As long as you have the will to stand, this staff shall not fail you.
The scarab holds a pearl aloft charged with the powers of life itself.
Wielded by countless mages before you, the staff is still light and tingling with magic.
As each petal unfurls, new secrets of healing are revealed.
Carved in winter and hardened over a burning Yule log, the energies of this staff fill one with the warmth of a cozy hearth.
Let your healing lift your team to the heights of the heavens.
Proof that healers can hurt, too.
"Purple and shimmering, a pearl of widsom and mercy descends into the fray."
A simple priest's staff was reforged into a terrible tool.
“Crafted from the infernal union of human and demon.”
“Crafted from the infernal union of human and demon.”
“Crafted from the infernal union of human and demon.”
“Crafted from the infernal union of human and demon.”
“Crafted from the infernal union of human and demon.”
Such a gladius has been stained not only with the blood of the Empire's foes, but with the rage of warriors past.
Dragons are fine friends to have, and dangerous foes to face.
A flash of red is the last thing you'll see before you hit the ground and begin to fade.
Slash your way through the naysayers of your musical talents.
"The perfect weapon to cut the rot out of someone's heart."
A ritual blade used for ceremonies none would speak of.
The fearsome claw of a terrible dark lord.
None question the one who wields this Azoth Staff.
As quick and as loud as a firecracker, this ornamental gun is more than meets the eye.
The orb atop this pillar of flame is carved of the finest jade known to Aeternum.
The sparkle of the handle alone is enough to draw in the big ones.
Feel the might of the generals of old coursing through your veins with each swing.
From the mouth of a great beast the bullet flies, sinking into its unlucky target.
Taking out this pickaxe to mine is a display of wealth and dominance.
Each blow blocked seems to further enrage the animal carved onto the shield, teeth glinting ever-sharper.
With this sickle you can reap what you sow, or more likely what others have sown.
A knife for dressing the animals of Aeternum in style.
"Darkness lies within the glint of gold."
A Mandolin for the sleepy sunsets in Brimstone Sands, with compatriots gathered around a fire to rest their weary battle arms.
Once this mandolin starts playing the urge to dance oneself to death becomes irresistible.
Something smells fishy about this Mandolin, but it plays like a siren's song.
Energy currents run through this piece of facial wear, giving the wearer the apperance of being a little more magical than they really are.
Even though it's made of wood, this mask makes you think of rock...
"The mysterious stranger, hardly glimpsed yet never forgotten.“
"When fear overtakes the land, his services find high demand.“
“Cast out evil with fury and righteous light.”
“Cast out evil with fury and righteous light.”
“Cast out evil with fury and righteous light.”
“Cast out evil with fury and righteous light.”
“Cast out evil with fury and righteous light.”
Music and the occult often dance hand in hand.
Even fish hear the call of rock.
Wail away on the nearest plank.
Chop it down with the edge of your scythe.
Clothe your band in the skins of fearsome beasts.
Can spot a breach at 10 paces. Maybe he needs glasses...
"Lure legendary fish into submission by wielding a pole that resembles their underwater allies."
"Long lost beneath the desert sands, now free to wreak its havoc.“
"Its kiss giveth life, its sting taketh it away."
"With this axe, you can swear the creak of the tree falling almost sounds like a wave cresting."
"For a musty relic contained for thousands of years, it doesn't smell as bad as I thought."
Shroud of the Pharaoh Chest Bandages
"For a musty relic contained for thousands of years, it doesn't smell as bad as I thought."
Shroud of the Pharaoh Foot Bandages
"For a musty relic contained for thousands of years, it doesn't smell as bad as I thought."
Shroud of the Pharaoh Hand Bandages
"For a musty relic contained for thousands of years, it doesn't smell as bad as I thought."
Shroud of the Pharaoh Head Bandages
"For a musty relic contained for thousands of years, it doesn't smell as bad as I thought."
Shroud of the Pharaoh Leg Bandages
Protect your pick from evil spirits today!
A fearsome beast, now lost to time, donated the bones that form this insidious blade.
"Some giant bird washed up on shore, not sure what it is, but its talons were damn sharp."
Sinister and sepulchral, armies of bone heed his summons.
Sinister and sepulchral, armies of bone heed his summons.
Sinister and sepulchral, armies of bone heed his summons.
Sinister and sepulchral, armies of bone heed his summons.
Sinister and sepulchral, armies of bone heed his summons.
"It's easier to hide any spills if you wear red, my friend."
"It's easier to hide any spills if you wear red, my friend."
"It's easier to hide any spills if you wear red, my friend."
"It's easier to hide any spills if you wear red, my friend."
"It's easier to hide any spills if you wear red, my friend."
"The murky depths shelter remnants of the primordial darkness.“
"The spark of life descends from the heavens."
And so the mountains rang with the cry of Hallelujah!
War may never change, but its tools have never been the same since.
Look down the sights of this musket and fire to deliver a snake bite to your enemies.
A Petalshot by any other name would kill just as sweetly.
Shots fired from the braided barrel guarantee a swift, almost merciful death before resurrection drags the soul back.
"If looks could kill, you wouldn't need this gun."
"Inflicts a sense of doom upon all its shots pierce."
It was forged and shaped from a single piece of imbued metal.
Let it sing its song, and close the portals that Corruption has brought forth.
A feathered bobber would be most appropriate here.
Let trees take flight as this axe separates them from their stumps.
All rocks and minerals crumble before the rising phoenix.
This golden bird wishes to help you with all of your gathering projects.
For skinning the diverse birds of Aeternum.
"A beacon to slice through the darkness, to lift the spirits of all who see it wielded by a champion of the light."
A weapon built to slice through the smallest opening in an opponents hamata.
This sting never wastes a drip of precious poison.
Ancient songs and carols fill the head of this sword's wielder, and often they sing along during the dance of battle. Wassail! Wassail!
Strike true to send your enemies careening back to the unforgiving earth of Aeternum.
Named so for its twist in the blade and the twisting you'll do inside your enemies.
"Much like an arrow of Cupid, its tip seeks to sink into a heart and endear itself there forever."
"Those of supple wrist find a florid friend in this."
An ornate blade that was gifted to a revered leader in the past. Though the ones who revered them may not have been quite so revered themselves.
Beautiful as it is deadly, a true guardian’s weapon.
The adventurer walks up to the corrupted portal and bangs their scepter on the ground, demanding its vanquishing.
From under the water this pole looks as bright and as harmless as the sun above. Fish will soon learn otherwise.
"None need doubt who their ruler is, lest they feel an icy hand close around their treasonous throat."
In a flourish of blinding light the forest falls before you.
Commands rock and ore to crumble alike.
The shimmer of this tool when used in the wild attracts the eyes of many a jealous adventurer.
Doubles as a letter opener for your all your regal missives.
A simple shield. It may not be as effective as other choices, but a jack-of-all-trades is many times better than a master of one.
The might of a dragon is never to be underestimated.
The stud eyes of the skull emblazoned on the front burn with fiery vengeance.
"Protection against attacks both physical and on one's fashion."
A simple construction of metal and wood. The wood seems to ward off dark spirits.
Such a shield is not suited to the tight formations such soldiers are known for, but not all battles are conducive to such tactics.
Block incoming blows with the enigmatic scarab of the desert's hard shell.
Block and press the advantage with both layers of metal adorned with floral filigree.
"A blossoming bulwark for defending against all blows."
It was made in the image of a vision given to the poor smith by a greater being.
"To protect from wickedness and champion purity, one must have a proper shield."
A wise warrior knows to protect not only themselves, but the rest of the testudo.
Phases of the moon wax and wane, but the power of this shield is a splendorous constant.
"A guard as mighty and florid as a palace garden wall."
It gazes upon your pitiful foes and weeps for them.
Corruption doesn't stand a chance when a champion brandishes this bad boy.
From the maw of a great serpe comes a strong, silent line with a bobber in the water sure to hook even the most fearsome fish.
This pickaxe moves swiftly through the air to bring an edge down on the poor, defenseless rock.
It takes serious dedication and skill to use this sickle without rending the plant with its spikes.
The knife to end all knives, and all lives.
A well-seasoned weapon. You can feel the experience of many soldiers flow up to its tip.
Two-pronged, eternally golden, and charged with the power of the pantheon.
Put your faith in the ever-moving heavens above and strike forth, chosen one.
"All manner of aquatic creatures know to fear the glint of this spear."
Every kill feels like an offering to the chthonic forces waiting just below the surface of the riotously merry holidays.
Each strike is elevated with the beauty of your weapon.
Ripped from a wrought iron fence in Brightwood and used instead to kill.
"The holes in the tip make the sounds of leaves rustling when thrown."
While it may look ornamental, the structure of the tip creates wounds that are quite difficult to stitch.
It takes a strong palm to play this instrument, one you can spot from several meters away in another musician.
Covered in silver trim boning, this large instrument can be heard for miles.
A Bass with natural accents of flowers and scales, harkening back to the heat of Aeternum summers.
"Close the pesky portals that lie between your settlement and your love's."
"Fish for underwater creatures and for compliments alike with this royal purple rod."
"Love as sharp as an axe edge for the felling of trees."
"Break that rock just like they broke your heart!"
"For the skinning of pelts to decorate the floor of a tent for two."
You wish to keep tearing forward, more and more and more…
The long-lost gauntlet of a long-forgotten ruler of the sands.
Dusk envelopes the western side of Aeternum and quickly sweeps the land as the sun sets for you.
There is no metal heavier than this.
Without a second thought you summon forth your void blade and pierce enemy skin.
A demon wielded this gauntlet as their preferred weapon. You can still feel its malice lingering in the fingertips.
The blood of the fallen gives the head of this hammer greater weight than it seems to have.
Forever intertwined, these two serpents bare their teeth for their next meal.
Bring down what none thought could be grounded.
One looks into the face of death often on Aeternum, but rarely is it this frightening.
"Is that heavy feeling in your body from seeing your beloved, or is it from the hammer they're burying into your chest?"
"The hammer pulses with the life it has taken from this world."
A terrifying weapon that was forged at the behest of a terrifying warrior.
While wielding this mystical tool, one hears the distant carols of a ghostly choir.
This friendly implement keeps one company while fishing upon the lonely ice.
Every swing fills the heart with warmth in anticipation of the cozy fire to come.
The ringing strikes upon stone and metal sound like the chimes of winter bells.
Winter giveth and winter taketh away. Well… mostly winter taketh away.
As sharp as the winter wind, this knife can deglove a kill before your fingers even feel a chill.

This animal hide is unnaturally hot to the touch, but once treated its sturdy quality is unparalleled.
A smoldering armor fragment that is perpetually hot to the touch.
A smoldering weapon fragment that is perpetually hot to the touch.
The slime of an acquatic snail.
an old Solvent that can be salvaged into Pure Solvent.
an old Solvent that can be salvaged into Pure Solvent.

A bow that snapped under its own draw weight. While it can't be repaired, maybe it can be re-made?
The flesh of a Sporebloom mushroom.
